intro: Erythrococca mannii, commonly known as the red cocculus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, white to yellowish flowers that are clustered in umbels. Its fruits are fleshy berries that turn red when mature, containing several seeds. Erythrococca mannii is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
